data.text:
NEW: Survey results reveal that 72% of voters support #CALeg reforming the Private Attorneys General Act. Voters across the political spectrum support empowering state regulators vs. the current lawsuit-first system. #FixPAGA https://bit.ly/4c4ARwt Voters were initially asked if they would support legislation modeled after the provisions of the PAGA initiative, which is currently eligible for November 2024 ballot. The proposal is supported by 72% of voters, including: 84% of Democrats, 64% of independent voters and 56% of Republicans. After a simulated campaign, with voters hearing equal support and opposition arguments, 64% of voters continue to support the proposal. It‚Äôs long past time for #CALeg to act and create a better, fairer system for workers, small businesses and non-profits. #FixPAGA

8

1 Comment

Highlights from the DOJ OpenJustice Los Angeles County Crime statistics: ‚Ä¢ Violent crimes reported in the county reached 61,193 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 12% from the 54,600 reported in 2020, the year Gascon took office. ‚Ä¢ Robberies reported in the county reached 17,635 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 16% from the 15,221 reported in 2020. ‚Ä¢ Property crimes reached 256,613 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 20% from the 213,377 reported in 2020. ‚Ä¢ Shoplifting in L.A. County reached 34,303 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 133% from the 14,714 reported in 2020. ‚Ä¢ Auto theft reached 61,024 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 23% from the 49,554 reported in 2020. ‚Ä¢ Burglaries reached 39,529 in 2023 ‚Äì UP 8% from the 36,725 reported in 2020.

Yet another distressing incident, this time a homeless individual attacking an elderly man in Whittier. The time for action is now, and fortunately, Whittier has a mayor who is committed to restoring safety to their city, unlike Mayor Bass of Los Angeles. While Governor Newsom's directive to clear homeless encampments may not bring about significant change, there is hope for Whittier. The homeless industrial complex, which has squandered taxpayer dollars for over a decade and led to a decline in residents' quality of life, must be dismantled. It's high time for substantial change. At WOFT, we provide you and your family with essential skills to handle unforeseen circumstances. Our training includes practical, personalized self-defense scenarios, ensuring you can protect what's most important to you! Every family should receive Real-Life Scenario Safety and Instruction, making them Safer, Smarter, and Stronger! Don't wait to enhance your family's safety. Act now and click the link in our bio to sign up for our upcoming classes. Remember, it's always better to be prepared than to wait for a scenario to escalate into a situation. #EndHomelessness #PrepareForAnything #excellence #ProtectYourFamily #BeProactive #SafetyFirst #StayAlert #VerbalJudo #WOFT #StaySafe #FamilySafety #OrlandoLearningCenter #SelfDefense #WOFTFlashlight #BePrepared #WOFTSafetyLearningExperience #RealLifeScenarioTraining #Florida #FamilyStrong #RealLifeSkills #FamilyFirst #InvestInSafety #PlanAhead #safetytraining #HardTarget #SituationalAwareness #OrlandoFlorida #safetyeducation #CuttingEdgeTraining Disclaimer: I condemn any actions of violence or hate. This is for educational purposes. This page does not intend to promote dangerous acts, organizations, violence, harassment, or bullying. Copyright Disclaimer Under section 107 of the Copyright Act of 1976, allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, education, and research.

Governor‚Äôs 2024 #MayRevise is Unacceptable for California‚Äôs Children and Families Today Governor Gavin Newsom released a revised #CABudget proposal that unfortunately doesn't protect progress made in children‚Äôs health equity in previous budget cycles. Read our full response here: https://lnkd.in/gVQmgqyd "The Governor said this #CABudget lays out a long-term, multi-year strategy. Children‚Äôs #HealthEquity is always a multi-year strategy. He is making a choice to cut the very programs families depend on to raise healthy, thriving children. Instead, California will spend billions of dollars on tax breaks for high-profit corporations.‚Äù - Mayra E Alvarez We're deeply disappointed Gov. Newsom didn't include ‚û°Ô∏è$$ to safeguard #HealthCare coverage for young children ‚û°Ô∏èthriving wages for community health workers ‚û°Ô∏èreliable internet access for families These would build #HealthEquity for historically marginalized communities of color. California has the resources to create #HealthEquity for children & families ‚Äì now we need the courage. CA must consider new, progressive revenues rather than weaken the critical services families rely on. CC: Dr. Seciah Aquino Andrew Cheyne

Washington State currently holds the unfortunate distinction of being the nation's leader in hate crimes. This alarming reality demands immediate action, and The Black Sanctuary is rising to the challenge. On Thursday, May 30, 2024, at 6:30 PM, please join The Black Sanctuary and the Seattle Chapter of the National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) for a vital event focused on driving awareness and initiating real change in the civil rights movement of today. This event will feature presentations by the Department of Justice's Civil Rights Division of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the United States Attorneys'‚Äã Offices. In the ongoing struggle to protect and advance civil rights, these institutions play a crucial role in upholding the law and ensuring that the rights of all citizens are respected and preserved. Please stand with us as we empower our community and forge a safer Washington. This call to action is not just an invitation‚Äîit's a moral imperative for everyone who believes in justice and equality. Your presence and support in this monumental effort, united by a shared vision of love and resilience, will ensure our future is undeniably brighter than our past. See you on May 30! #justice #humanrights #equality #activism #love #community #racism #education #racialjustice #antiracism #bethechange #activist #equity #civilrights #diversity #socialchange #hope #protest #change #ally #peace #equalrights #humanity #inclusion #equalityforall #law

5

Woman arrested by FBI for surrogacy fraud Lillian Arielle Markowitz has been arrested by the FBI for fraud relating to three surrogacy and donor agencies that she owned.. She used to run three California agencies: My Donor Cycle, Surrogacy Beyond Borders and Expecting Surrogacy. We have never worked with any of those. Without commenting on the case (as Ms Markowtiz is entitled to the presumption of innocence), intended parents must take extreme care when dealing with surrogacy agencies abroad, including ensuring that thorough due diligence is undertaken. Australian intended parents have been burnt by dodgy surrogacy agencies before in places like the US, Mexico, India and Greece. While most surrogacy agencies are reputable, regrettably some are not. The idea that there is a government guarantee of surrogacy agencies anywhere in the world is fanciful. There remain sharks in the waters, lured by big easy money from those desperate to become parents. Always take care. If the deal seems too good to be true, it probably is. It is a criminal offence in the ACT, QLD and NSW to enter into commercial surrogacy arrangements overseas. Those living in the NT, SA and WA may also be committing criminal offences in engaging in commercial surrogacy overseas.

1

Over 1,000 organizations across California agree: We must #ProtectFURS Yesterday, through The Children‚Äôs Movement of California, over 1,000 organizations signed on and sent a letter to Governor Newsom urging him to keep the Family Urgent Response System in the state budget. The in-person helpline specifically designed to support foster youth and caregivers is currently proposed to be eliminated. This collective show of strength sends the clear message that California should never abandon foster kids to balance its budget. View the letter in its entirety here: https://bit.ly/4adlgcD We are hopeful tomorrow's release of the #CABudget May Revision will show FURS has been reinstated, and the collective voice of over 1,000 organizations has been heard. If it does not, we will remain vigilant and continue fighting for foster youth through all the final budget negotiations. You can still help and join us here: https://bit.ly/48lMAo2

ALERT | California Governor Announces PAGA Reform Deal Reached, Removing Ballot Proposal | 07.20.2024 On June 18, 2024, Governor Newsom‚Äôs office announced that the pending ballot initiative to repeal PAGA (the Private Attorneys General Act) would be removed from the November ballot, due to a ‚Äúnegotiated deal,‚Äù reforming PAGA in a way that, ‚Äúworks for both business and workers,‚Äù and will ‚Äúbring improvements to this system.‚Äù This package was, per Politico, negotiated over several weeks ‚Äúbehind the scenes.‚Äù This is similar to recent FAST Act reforms that were removed from the ballot, and also negotiated behind the scenes, and benefitting some parties more than others. Click here to read more: https://lnkd.in/gYwQxW8u #AALRR #PAGA #NegotiatedDeal

The Latest: In a significant step, the California Senate passed Senator Steve Glazer‚Äôs SB1327 today with a bipartisan 27-7 vote, which would create an employment subsidy, providing $500 million per year for local news. In a statement, Rebuild Local News President Steven Waldman said, "This is a historic milestone for the bill‚Ä¶ While further negotiations with various stakeholders are expected, this decisive action sends a powerful message: something must be done, and major tech companies must be part of the solution." Learn more: https://lnkd.in/gnDcV_E8 #California #Journalism #LocalNews #Tax #Tech #Media #RebuildLocalNews

Disability Rights California (DRC) and Disability Rights Education and Defense Fund (DREDF) are urging lawmakers to not pass laws against wearing masks during public protests. People with disabilities have the right to participate in the community safely during the ongoing pandemic. State and local governments are increasingly proposing mask bans as a response to public protest. Mask bans are laws that make it illegal for people to wear masks in public. These laws make it harder and even impossible for disabled people and their allies to access public spaces ‚Äì including collective actions for the expression of constitutionally protected speech ‚Äì without fear and harassment. They put disabled people and their family members at greater risk of contracting COVID-19 and other infectious diseases. Wearing a mask is not a crime. People who wish to wear a mask to protect themselves from infectious diseases at protests or anywhere else have the right to do so. Read the full statement: https://lnkd.in/gXnWEgiK

üö® 33% of the election administration officials we researched in Nevada raised cause for concern due to some form of anti-democracy activity. üö® It‚Äôs more important than ever that we understand the processes and personnel governing the post-vote process to maintain free and fair elections. Our Election Administration report in Nevada sheds light on the vote counting and certification process in Nevada to support advocates, litigators, and journalists who are best positioned to counter existing threats. Also in the report, you‚Äôll find a detailed timeline of post-vote processes, a research database of election officials, and information about the offices and personnel who oversee counting and certification. https://lnkd.in/eugcmX6f

Published Friday in our print edition and available now online, ‚ÄúCaught In The Crosshairs‚Äù is a new series on gun violence by staff writer Robert J. Hansen. It explores the impact of gun violence on the Black community in Sacramento and was funded by the USC Annenberg Center for Health Journalism‚Äôs 2024 California Health Equity Impact Fund. Gun violence remains a major concern in Sacramento, particularly for the African American community which, despite comprising 12.6% of the county's population, represents about 52% of all gun-related deaths. It's important to note the disparity in the resolution of homicide cases, with nearly twice as many cases involving black victims remaining unsolved. Prevention programs such as Advance Peace have shown success in reducing violence, yet more needs to be done. Accessibility of firearms to youth, especially stolen guns, is a major factor contributing to the violence. Strikingly, guns reported as lost or stolen are significantly more likely to be used in a crime. A 2024 UC Davis Health study proposes tracking the movement of firearms for effective prevention. Initiatives such as Brother to Brother are also playing a significant role in mentoring young men to avoid the path of violence. What strategies do you think could effectively reduce gun violence in communities? üîó: https://bit.ly/3U2WyWp
